I can't seem to change the destination folder. what to do?

@oneawesome

You can't. Minecraft is coded to run in that directory and places all the files there, even if you run it from another directory.

Hi TeamExtreme when are you going to Update your 1.4.7 server to 1.5 server!!!

And one more question what are the Best recommended Specs for Minecraft!!!

TeamExtreme can you Please give me a link for this  
skin http://teamextrememc.com/server.html this Warriror skin i really want it but cant find it!!!

@wolfenstein4

Yes indeed we are.

 If you take a look on our forums, you will see we have a close beta. Our Beta server will replace our 1.4.7 server as our new 1.5 server in a few days.

What are the best specs?

Minecraft is mostly a CPU based game, using 1 core, so a faster CPU is better but here are the official specs:

    CPU : Intel Pentium D or AMD Athlon 64 (K8) 2.6 GHz
    RAM : 4GB
    GPU : GeForce 6xxx or ATI Radeon 9xxx and up with OpenGL 2 Support (Excluding Integrated Chipsets)
    HDD : 150MB

Hope this helped.

@wolfenstein4

That skin is my personal skin that I edited, which is why you can't find it anywhere :P

And thanks for the specs and server info cheers ;)
@TeamExtreme Just a heads up, Chicago Data Center servers are shit and its going to cause a lot of issues with latency for people in NV most specifically and a lot of people outside of there as well.
I can't connect to other servers

I can't for the life of me get this version to run mods. I have a good enough computer, I have 64 bit Java, the torrent works fine, when I install it clean and play it offline..I'm not worried about playing online either..I just want to be able to install mods but it always crashes. Always.

hello i just download your minecraft 1.5 version i lunched it and then when i tried to log in a java error appeared here is a photo of the error http://prntscr.com/zmaon ( i have windows 7 32 bit) can i do something for that :/
I can't log onto servers with "online-mode=true" in the configs. (NB: They're not my server)

Oh, @TeamExtreme
It's possible to run Minecraft from a different directory (as in the .minecraft folder in another directory).

This launcher is able to do it and yes, you can use it to play "offline" with a username. It works.
(Enter a username and random password)
And you have to install Minecraft using this torrent FIRST before using this program.

http://magiclauncher.com/adloadx.php?f=MagicLauncher_1.0.0.exe
(Sorry, dev's website has ads)
Omg so amazing thanks bro for all that!
